title: Jollof Rice
summary: A classic West African one-pot rice dish cooked with tomatoes, peppers, and spices.

title: Egusi Soup
summary: A hearty Nigerian soup made with ground melon seeds, leafy greens, and assorted meats.

title: Suya
summary: Popular street food of spicy grilled beef skewers coated with yaji (suya spice mix).

title: Moi Moi
summary: Steamed bean pudding made from blended black-eyed peas, peppers, and spices.

title: Pounded Yam and Efo Riro
summary: Smooth pounded yam served with a rich spinach and tomato-based stew.

title: Akara
summary: Deep-fried bean cakes made from blended black-eyed peas and onions, often eaten at breakfast.

title: Pepper Soup
summary: A spicy and aromatic broth made with fish, goat meat, or chicken and traditional spices.

title: Ofada Rice and Ayamase
summary: Local Nigerian rice served with green pepper stew, usually spicy and flavorful.

title: Okra Soup
summary: Slimy and nutritious soup cooked with okra, palm oil, and assorted proteins.

title: Boli (Roasted Plantain)
summary: Charcoal-roasted ripe plantains, often served with groundnut sauce or peppered sauce.

title: Nkwobi
summary: A delicacy made from cow foot cooked in palm oil sauce and traditional spices.

title: Zobo Drink
summary: Refreshing hibiscus flower drink spiced with ginger, cloves, and pineapple.
